title: Raiders coach Jon Gruden on brother Jay's firing from Redskins: 'Welcome to the club, bro'
text:
CLOSE SportsPulse: Week 5 had revenge games and shocking upsets. Lorenzo Reyes delivers this weeks power rankings and biggest risers and fallers. USA TODAY

Brotherly ribbing is apparently always tolerated in the Gruden household, even when one of the siblings has lost his job.

Oakland Raiders coach Jon Gruden lamented that his brother, Jay, was fired by the Washington Redskins on Monday. He also took the opportunity to get a subtle dig in on his younger bro.

"My dad's been fired," Gruden told reporters during his weekly news conference. "I've been fired. Jay's been fired, and welcome to the club, bro."

It may not be the best club to join, but at least Jay has some familial company. And Jon first expressed sadness his brother could not get the job done in Washington.

"I'm obviously very disappointed for my brother," Gruden said. "It was a long night, last couple of nights. He worked hard. Got a lot of respect for my brother. Obviously, disappointed for him getting fired."

Jon Gruden before his second stint as Oakland Raiders coach visits his brother Jay at Washington Redskins practice in 2014. Jay was fired Monday. (Photo: AP)

Jon Gruden would not speculate whether Jay, who was hired as the Redskins' coach in 2014, may join his staff in the future.

After the Tampa Bay Buccaneers fired the elder Gruden in 2008, he founded the "Fired Football Coaches Association" and spent the next nine seasons in the Monday Night Football booth on ESPN before returning to the Raiders sideline in 2018.
description: Oakland Raiders coach Jon Gruden was upset brother Jay Grude was fired by the Washington Redskins, although he did say "Welcome to the club, bro."
